    Plot a keyboard using ggplot2. Originally from ggkeyboard

    ggkeyboard.Rd

    Plot a keyboard using ggplot2. Originally from ggkeyboard

    ggkeyboard(
  keyboard = tkl,
  palette = keyboard_palette("pastel"),
  layout = c("ansi", "iso"),
  font_family = "Arial Unicode MS",
  font_size = 2,
  adjust_text_colour = TRUE,
  measurements = keyboard_measurements("default")
)

    Arguments

    keyboard

    Keyboard data. A data frame with the key name, what row of the keyboard it is in, and key width. Defaults to tkl (a tenkeyless layout). Other available keyboards are a full keyboard (full), 60% keyboard (sixty_percent), and a basic mac keyboard (mac).

    palette

    Colour palette. Defaults to keyboard_palette("pastel"). To use a custom palette, create a vector with the names described in keyboard_palette.

    layout

    Keyboard layout - one of "ansi" or "iso". Defaults to "ansi".

    font_family

    Font used. Defaults to "Arial Unicode MS". See the extrafont package for using fonts in ggplot2.

    font_size

    Base font size. Defaults to 3.

    adjust_text_colour

    Whether to lighten the text colour on dark keys. Defaults to TRUE.

    measurements

    Measurements of various aspects of the keyboard key height and width, gaps between keys and rows, etc. See keyboard_measurements.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
ggkeyboard()

ggkeyboard(sixty_percent, palette = keyboard_palette("cyberpunk"))
} # }
